required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety and Efficacy Study of Teduglutide in Pediatric Participants With Short Bowel Syndrome (SBS)
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Open-label, Long-term Safety and Efficacy Study of Teduglutide in Pediatric Patients With Short Bowel Syndrome Who Completed TED-C14-006 or SHP633-301

brief_summary.textblock: This study will follow participants who completed the TED-C14-006 study. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of teduglutide in pediatric participants with Short Bowel Syndrome (SBS). This study will also offer teduglutide treatment to eligible participants, regardless of treatment received in TED-C14-006 or SHP633-301.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urine Output
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Urine output will be recorded in the output diary over a 48-hour period of nutritional stability before every clinic visit, and within 1 week of implementing a change in the PN prescription.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Stool Output
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Stool output will be recorded in the output diary over a 48-hour period of nutritional stability before every clinic visit, and within 1 week of implementing a change in the PN prescription.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants classified as having positive specific antibodies to teduglutide will be used to summarize the presence of antibodies.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight Z-Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in body weight Z-Score will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Length Z-Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in length Z-Score will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Head Circumference Z-Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in head circumference Z-Score will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index Z-Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in body mass index Z-Score will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Achieve At least a 20 Percent (%) Reduction From Baseline in Parenteral Support (PS) Volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who achieve at least a 20% reduction from baseline in PS volume will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Change in PS volume will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants who Were Completely Weaned off Parenteral Support (PS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who were completely weaned off parenteral support (PS) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Days per Week of Parenteral Support (PS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in days per week of parenteral support (PS) will be assessed.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL) Score
other_outcome.description: The Child and Parent Reports of the PedsQL Generic Core Scale for Young Pediatric subjects (ages 5-7), Pediatric subjects (ages 8-12), and Teens (ages 13-18) are composed of 23 items comprising 4 dimensions as follows: 1) Physical Functioning (8 items), 2) Emotional Functioning (5 items), 3) Social Functioning (5 items), 4) School Functioning (5 items).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Pediatric Quality of Life inventory (PedsQL) in Family Impact Module Score
other_outcome.description: The 36-item PedsQL Family Impact Module consists of 6 scales measuring parent self-reported functioning as follows: 1) Physical Functioning (6 items), 2) Emotional Functioning (5 items), 3) Social Functioning (4 items), 4) Cognitive Functioning (5 items; worries about treatment and disease), 5) Communication (3 items), 6) Worry (5 items).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Pediatric Quality of Life inventory (PedsQL) Gastrointestinal Symptoms Sub-scales for Food and Drink Limits and Diarrhea
other_outcome.description: The PedsQL Gastrointestinal Symptom Module is a disease-specific 58-item module, comprised of 10 different symptom scales that assess gastrointestinal symptom-related quality of life: food and drink limits, trouble swallowing, heartburn and reflux, nausea and vomiting, gas and bloating, constipation, blood in poop, and diarrhea.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive 0.05 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) of teduglutide subcutaneous (SC) injections once daily into 1 of the 4 quadrants of the abdomen or into either the thigh or arm as needed in addition to SOC treatment.

intervention.description: Standard safety assessments and adjustments in nutritional support.
Teduglutide will be administered using syringe.
Teduglutide will be administered using needle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participant provides written informed consent (participant, parent or legal guardian and, as appropriate, informed assent) to participate in the study before completing any study-related procedures.
2. Participant completed the TED-C14-006 or SHP633-301 studies (including participants in the standard of care treatment arms). Participants are considered to have completed SHP633-301 if they completed study assessments through week 24.
3. Participant understands and is willing and able to fully adhere to study requirements as defined in this protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. There are no exclusion criteria for this study.

facility.name: University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health
Walter C. Mackenzie Health Science Centre

patient_data.ipd_description: Shire provides access to the de-identified individual participant data for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives. These IPDs will be provided following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.shiretrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
